description:
Create an HttpRequest that targets the Pokemon API endpoint for Pikachu.

Before starting, add https://pokeapi.co to your Remote Site Settings in Setup.

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest variable named 'request'
2. Set the endpoint to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu'
3. Set the HTTP method to 'GET'

delta.insert:
Create an HttpRequest that targets the Pokemon API endpoint for Pikachu.

Before starting, add https://pokeapi.co to your Remote Site Settings in Setup.

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest variable named 'request'
2. Set the endpoint to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu'
3. Set the HTTP method to 'GET'

template:
HttpRequest request = new HttpRequest();
// Set the endpoint and method
requirements: Create an HttpRequest variable named 'request'
Set the endpoint to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu'
Set the HTTP method to 'GET'
tests:
HttpRequest request = new HttpRequest();
Assert.isNotNull(request, 'HttpRequest must be created');

description:
Send a GET request to the Pokemon API and verify you get a successful response.

Make sure https://pokeapi.co is in your Remote Site Settings.

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest and set the endpoint to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu' with method 'GET'
2. Create an Http instance and send the request, storing the result in an HttpResponse variable named 'response'
3. The response status code should be 200

2. Create an Http instance and send the request, storing the result in an HttpResponse variable named 'response'
3. The response status code should be 200

requirements: Create an HttpRequest and set the endpoint to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu' with method 'GET'
Create an Http instance and send the request, storing the result in an HttpResponse variable named 'response'
The response status code should be 200

description:
Call the Pokemon API for Pikachu and extract the name from the JSON response.

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu' with method 'GET'
2. Send the request using an Http instance
3. Get the response body and deserialize it using JSON.deserializeUntyped(), cast it to Map<String, Object> and store in a variable named 'pokemon'
4. Extract the 'name' value as a String into a variable named 'name'

4. Extract the 'name' value as a String into a variable named 'name'

description:
Call the Pokemon API for Pikachu and extract the weight and height from the response.

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu' with method 'GET' and send it
2. Deserialize the response body using JSON.deserializeUntyped() and cast to Map<String, Object>
3. Extract the 'weight' value as an Integer into a variable named 'weight'
4. Extract the 'height' value as an Integer into a variable named 'height'

3. Extract the 'weight' value as an Integer into a variable named 'weight'
4. Extract the 'height' value as an Integer into a variable named 'height'

requirements: Create an HttpRequest to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu' with method 'GET' and send it
Deserialize the response body using JSON.deserializeUntyped() and cast to Map<String, Object>

Extract the 'height' value as an Integer into a variable named 'height'

description:
Call the Pokemon API for Pikachu and extract the first type name from the nested JSON response.

The types structure in the response looks like this:
"types": [{"slot": 1, "type": {"name": "electric"}}]

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest to 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/pikachu' with method 'GET' and send it
2. Deserialize the response body and cast to Map<String, Object>
3. Extract the 'types' value as a List<Object>
4. Get the first entry from the list, cast it to Map<String, Object>, then navigate into the nested 'type' object and extract the 'name' as a String into a variable named 'typeName'

description:
Build a dynamic Pokemon lookup: use the provided 'pokemonName' variable to call the Pokemon API for any Pokemon, and extract both the name and weight from the response.

Requirements:
1. Create an HttpRequest with endpoint 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/' + pokemonName and method 'GET'
2. Send the request and verify the status code is 200
3. Deserialize the response body and cast to Map<String, Object>
4. Extract the 'name' value as a String into a variable named 'name'
5. Extract the 'weight' value as an Integer into a variable named 'weight'

delta.insert:

2. Send the request and verify the status code is 200
3. Deserialize the response body and cast to Map<String, Object>
4. Extract the 'name' value as a String into a variable named 'name'
5. Extract the 'weight' value as an Integer into a variable named 'weight'

template:
// pokemonName variable is already provided
// Call the API dynamically and extract name and weight
requirements: Create an HttpRequest with endpoint 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2/pokemon/' + pokemonName and method 'GET'
Send the request and verify the status code is 200
Deserialize the response body and cast to Map<String, Object>
Extract the 'name' value as a String into a variable named 'name'
Extract the 'weight' value as an Integer into a variable named 'weight'

description:
Create a reusable PokemonService class that wraps Pokemon API calls.

Make sure https://pokeapi.co is in your Remote Site Settings.

Requirements:
1. Create a public class named 'PokemonService'
2. Create a public static final String variable named 'BASE_URL' with value 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2'
3. Create a public method named 'getPokemon' that accepts a String parameter 'pokemonName' and returns Map<String, Object> — it must make a GET request to BASE_URL + '/pokemon/' + pokemonName and return the deserialized response
4. Create a public method named 'getPokemonWeight' that accepts a String parameter 'pokemonName' and returns an Integer by calling getPokemon and extracting the 'weight' value
5. Create a public method named 'getPokemonHeight' that accepts a String parameter 'pokemonName' and returns an Integer by calling getPokemon and extracting the 'height' value

requirements: Create a public class named 'PokemonService'
Create a public static final String variable named 'BASE_URL' with value 'https://pokeapi.co/api/v2'

Create a public method named 'getPokemon' that accepts a String parameter 'pokemonName' and returns Map<String, Object> — it must make a GET request to BASE_URL + '/pokemon/' + pokemonName and return the deserialized response
Create a public method named 'getPokemonWeight' that accepts a String parameter 'pokemonName' and returns an Integer by calling getPokemon and extracting the 'weight' value

tests:
PokemonService service = new PokemonService();
Assert.isNotNull(service, 'PokemonService class must exist');
Assert.areEqual('https://pokeapi.co/api/v2', PokemonService.BASE_URL, 'BASE_URL must be https://pokeapi.co/api/v2');
